questions.question: The ratio of the linear dimensions of element of the object as represented in a drawing to the actual dimensions of the same element of the object itself is called _______.
questions.explanation: Scale is the ratio of the drawing size to the actual object size.

questions.question: When the drawing is of the same size as that of the object, the scale used is _______.
questions.explanation: A full-size scale means 1:1 drawing size, equal to the real object.

questions.question: What does the term 'Enlarging Scale' refer to?

answers.a: Drawing smaller than the actual size
answers.b: Drawing larger than the actual size

questions.explanation: Enlarging scale is used when the drawing is larger than the real object.

questions.question: Where should we mention the R.F. of the scale?

answers.b: Upper right corner of the sheet

questions.explanation: R.F. is conventionally written below the scale in engineering drawings.

questions.question: How is the length of a scale calculated in the construction process?

answers.a: Length of the scale = R.F. / Maximum Length
answers.b: Length of the scale = R.F. × Maximum Length
answers.c: Length of the scale = Maximum Length / R.F.
answers.d: Length of the scale = R.F. - Maximum Length

questions.explanation: Scale length = R.F. × actual max length to be measured.

questions.question: Drawings of buildings are drawn using ________
questions.explanation: Reducing scale is used when the real object is larger than the drawing.

questions.question: For drawing small instruments, the R.F. would be _______
questions.explanation: For small parts, drawings are enlarged, hence R.F. > 1.

questions.question: Expressing the relation between the dimension on the drawing and the actual dimension of the object is mentioned numerically in the style as 10 mm = 5 m etc. is referred to as-
questions.explanation: Engineering scale expresses scale using numerical length ratios.

questions.question: What does R.F. refer to?
questions.explanation: R.F. or Representative Fraction = Drawing length / Actual length.

questions.question: Given the length of the scale = 1/14080 miles and the scale to be measured is 6 miles, then the R.F. = ________
